question: Which city in Japan ceased to exist as a city on July 1, 1943?

content: Question: Which city in Japan ceased to exist as a city on July 1, 1943?

<python>
# Search for cities in Japan that ceased to exist around July 1, 1943
results = search_pages("cities in Japan ceased to exist 1943")[:10]

for result in results:
    title = result['title']
    page_id = result['page_id']
    content = read_section(page_id + ":full")
    
    # Look for specific references to July 1, 1943 or dissolution of cities
    if "July 1, 1943" in content or "ceased to exist" in content or "disbanded" in content:
        print(f"=== {title} ===")
        print(content)
        break
</python>

=== List of cities in Japan ===
# List of cities in Japan

*Revision ID: 1148260024 | Timestamp: 2023-04-05T01:53:05Z*

---

[[in Japan.png|thumb|](File:Cities)]

This is a **list of [cities](Cities of Japan) in [Japan](Japan)** sorted by [prefecture](Prefectures of Japan) and within prefecture by founding date. The list is also sortable by population, area, density and foundation date. Most large cities in Japan are [designated by government ordinance](cities)(Cities designated by government ordinance of Japan). Some regionally important cities are designated as [cities](core)(core cities of Japan). [Tokyo](Tokyo) is *not* included on this list, as the [of Tokyo](City)(Tokyo City) ceased to exist on July 1, 1943. Tokyo now exists as a special metropolis prefecture (都 *to*), with [special wards](23)(Special wards of Tokyo) (with the same status of city) making up the former boundaries of the former city in the eastern half of the prefecture.
